bow: how do parent my month old eta thank you for all the responses this is my first post on this sub reddit and knew came to the right place you all are so encouraging and supportive thank you thank you thank you this is very long know but really need some advice and wanted to be as detailed as possible so please if you have time can you read and give some advice feel like such failure of mother have spent my whole life knowing wanted to be mother grew up babysitting for all the neighbourhood kids nannied for year old at one point am teacher but teach high school kids have always loved spending time with my nephews there are seven of them even took care of one of my nephews one day week from the age of months years so guess expected that moming would be no problem for me well here am months in and feeling like am just not cut out for this my babe has been tough one from the get go he was never good sleeper though that is finally improving and he has always been on the fussy end of the spectrum from months he slept so much during the day that it was too hard to entertain him when he was awake but he did require me to constantly bounce him walk around with him etc when he was awake could not put him down on in anything and also could just sit down and hold him he has never been cuddly baby and never simply wanted to be held or snuggled or rocked no he had to be held face out and walked around the house and bounced but as said the amount of wake time was minimal so was only ever doing this for an hour at time here and there throughout the day also chalked it up to being in the fourth trimester and told myself that things would get better cut to now he is months old and things are not better his wake time between naps is about hours hours before bed and am finding it so hard to parent him during these times he is only ever happy if take him for walk or take bath with him when do either of those two things he is totally chill happy content here is what typical hour wake time looks like for us not including breast feeding which happens somewhere in there as well lay him down on our big foam mat on his back and play with him he will roll around bit and play bit but he will begin to fuss after 10 mins and then slowly escalate to full on crying then try to pull him into my lap he squirms and thrusts his hips and continues to cry try singing to him again he still cries sit him up and give him toy he still cries give him teether he bites it once and then cries more try giving him snack he cries eventually take him outside and we go for walk and then he is perfectly happy and content it does matter what activity start with it always starts out okay for few mins and then shortly after he is crying if am proactive might be able to move him from one activity to another before he melts down but this would literally involve me doing something new with him every five minutes which is exhausting am at complete loss as to what to do wind up in tears at the end of every day because am so exhausted today went on five different walks with him the upside is actually below my pre prey weight and we spent 40 mins in the bath together but this just does seem sustainable to me plus live in canada and winter is coming do recall any of my nephews being like this also ca hear anybody tell me it just phase one more time because he has never been chill so guess my questions are is this normal behaviour for month old how should be responding know you ca spoil newborn by picking them up responding to their cries but at what point does that stop being true am doing something wrong do understand why my baby seems to be so unhappy so often love him to pieces but am also so resentful that ca enjoy this stage of my child life because it is so hard when meet up with friends or my sisters and their babies get so jealous that they seem to just play on the floor contentedly while am doing everything in my power to distract mine and keep him from crying please help my daughter months old was like this before we did sleep training mostly because she was never well rested and therefore perpetually unhappy but if there are any problems with his sleep schedule my next thought question would be to ask if he is meeting all of his developmental milestones usually around this age they are very distracted with the world around them so they start to be able to occupy themselves for longer periods of time does he roll himself around and explore does he play with toys on his own is he happier if you re walking around and holding him do you babywear if not it was is seriously lifesaver god that walk thing sounds hard sorry have you tried baby wearing him mine is stage clinger too and has never been just okay with doing his own thing ever he requires constant attention the only way get anything done is by wearing him when he teething he will scream like mad man the second you set him down or dare to try to sit with him instead of walking and cooing and rubbing his back but he always quiet and content strapped to me only know your baby from what you ve said about him but willing to bet that this will stop once he has bit more mobility and can explore on his own by rolling around and crawling baby wearing is great idea plus take him places you want to go malls and big stores are great lots of attention for cute babies does he like to pick things up my fussy baby loved picking up stuff so tray of cheerios or baby puffs would focus her attention for long while remember to take some time for you too away from your little one hang in there you are doing everything right try getting him more stimulating toys maybe ones that are little advanced at months my daughter loved this einstein kids music toy that flashed lights and her bouncer definitely recommend bouncer and swing babies like movement between these two things linked below baby was never bored sorry for the crazy long urls https www walmart com ip fisher price luv zoo jumperoo 15162354 action=product interest amp action type=title amp item id=15162354 amp placement id=irs 302 m3 amp strategy=pwvub amp visitor id=dxovtpbcdfaw hjmqr55oy amp category= amp client guid=e4d017b6 e43b 43fd 823f ef97a4893194 amp customer id enc= amp config id=302 amp parent item id=46425698 amp parent anchor item id=46425698 amp guid=69ba78e5 43bb 4294 85cb bf9719bc877b amp bucket id=irsbucketdefault amp beacon version=1 amp findingmethod=p13n http www target com fisher price my little snugapuppy cradle swing 14583532 ref=tgt adv xs000000 amp afid=google pla df amp cpng=pla baby 2bshopping amp adgroup=sc baby amp lid=700000001170770pgs amp network=g amp device=m amp location=1013789 amp gclid=cj0keqjw6uo brdbzujwtuzazfkbeiqaanhj0afzorboobg7tqyh2 4gpt9uhf3mu7dwlgfylylaaagaatvs8p8haq amp gclsrc=aw ds this answer sleep trained my 10 month old and he been sleeping through the night since like forever he also well rested and meeting exceeding milestones find that long sleep during the night gets him ready for day of lots of learning eating brain activity and playing with naps per day although they are short naps so nothing fancy he has big play pen and plays with all his toys while crawling several times day he ll crawl on the open floor the baby needs long sleep he needs energy my son knows that he well loved and was never worse for the wear during sleep training also want to add that at months had to abruptly stop breastfeeding and noticed that this caused an immediate change in him he instantly became independent and did become fussy the moment touched him which was due to only associating me with breastfeeding now he associates me with play time and laughter but that up to op and she ll wean baby when she and and baby are ready get jumperoo they re lifesaver can get like 10 20 minutes while he bounces around and spins himself between the toys my guy likes standing whole lot if sitting ll help him stand on the floor between my knees he plays on his play mat for maybe five minutes before getting bored swap out toys and teethers and those seem to help us get more mileage out of it my babies have both lived in carriers have him face out and we do stuff around the house while he in there we also go for lot of walks baby wearing keeps me sane hang in there the stage between being tiny infant and baby on the move is frustrating for them they want to see stuff but they ca get to anything it ll get better once he can help himself out more to reach interesting stuff also try and find group of moms with babies his age it makes me feel more normal yes definitely bouncer or jolly jumper we have two stationary bouncers and jumper that rotate my kid between during play time along with lots of floor play it is exhausting to keep moving them around every 10 minutes and keep them interested but the older they get they seem to be able to occupy themselves for longer periods my oldest was like that you have my sympathies how does he do in the car we took lots of car rides around that age the library near us had weekly baby storytime that was novel enough to hold his attention so did the community rec center we went to any place that made the walks less boring for me the zoo botanical gardens the mall etc it was go go go to keep him happy also babywearing as others have said for what it worth my son did get much easier around 10 11 months so there is hope think due to sleep training and finally becoming mobile he was late crawler shortly after his first birthday remember thinking that he was the happiest toddler ever although it probably only seemed that way because of the hell he put me through for the first year hah yes can not emphasize baby wearing enough ops post sounds like my life years ago my little one is just in kindergarten now clingy babies do grow out of it eventually mom do worry you re doing great still say the best investment of my life was my baby wrap yeah constant change of activities and leaving the house is what we do once he started sitting on his own started taking him to the playground plopping him in the corner with his toys and sitting next to him he likes to watch the kids play but we ve definitely gone through phases where nothing is good in the world he basically lived in the baby carrier at the beginning and has never been interested in playing on his own do have answers sorry but my first was very similar and felt the same way now almost my daughter is just full on kid and it challenge to keep her busy still childcare was lifesaver for me at 10 months they provided the stimulation and social interaction she needed and went back to work and got the stimulation needed proof it was my moming baby is the complete opposite very chilled out and great sleeper if you do your urls like this they ll be shorter and have nice name name link do think you re doing anything wrong in fact say that you trying so hard to keep him entertained means you re doing things right even though know it does always feel that way months was really hard age for us as well think he was desperate to be more mobile but had reached that point yet developmentally plus he had teeth coming in it also rough because at that age they are starting to have more specific wants rather than just needs but it all kind of guessing game used to get so frustrated when my mom came over to play with him every week and he always seemed so much happier playing with her but my husband pointed out that she was new and exciting and also generally had more energy than me since she was not so run down it possible that your experiences with your nephews are similar to my mom with my son that being said you should check out this article some babies are just easier than others http mobile nytimes com blogs well 2016 03 14 some babies are just easier than others referer= know lot of people have mentioned baby wearing car rides my son hated both still does at 10 months he liked being read to but obviously the books are short so do last long but he used to get us to read him hop on pop over and over and over there were definitely some books he just did like though also and know this is controversial the tv was big help he has never cared for cartoons but there this band called walk off the earth that does lot of cover videos on youtube where the camera is on their faces as they sing rather than just random music video stuff and he loves watching those seriously they calm him down like nothing else and it was such relief for me to have bit of break if you re interested in giving this try the first videos of theirs that he was really into were the hello cover with the surf board and tap dancers and the ca feel my face cover anyways you have my sympathies months was really hard age cause they want to be entertained but ca do it themselves sending you some internet hugs so so sorry for you this was just like my first child she did sleep colicky and hated the world since she was refluxy only the swing bouncer chair and baby wearing kept her upright enough to pacify her we got great swing with toys and tray and used it lot it got better around 10 months though fyi she is and still bad sleeper another small ray of sunshine our second daughter is opposite happy cheerful loves everyone and all the toys plays by self and sleeps just letting you know sometimes it just their personalities take very very good care of you until this passes and get daycare and babysitters no matter what it takes so you can have cool down time from what ve read it almost always resolves by 1so your new mantra is months at most just few more months can do few months also do be afraid to tell your friends and family how bad it is they may be able to help if any of them has been through fussy baby they will help know when someone gets fussy one now charge in their with food house cleaning babysitting anything can do to help cause ve been there welcome to the fussy velcro baby support club am so damn glad to alumni and you will be too soon removed can you recommend any resources that you used for the sleep training you did ftm and still expecting but want to read up thanks can so relate to your story my son is about months and very much the same he such whiner have bunch of activities that we rotate through throughout each wake time toys on the playmat bouncer reading books this works particularly well when he is starting to fuss put bright book in front of him and it is good distraction toys on the bed looking at the baby in the mirror toys in the crib eating solids he really likes to suck on steamed broccoli and will do this happily sometimes for like 15 mins honestly sometimes put on baby show on the ipad for bit to help him relax if he is fussy and need mental break some of his fave toys are not actually toys at all and he will play longer with little enamel pot wooden spoon silicone basting brush etc especially when it is something new he has seen before the other thing is that feel like they are desperate to get mobile at this age and that is why he is so frustrated all the time so have been trying to keep that in mind he is frustrated too and when we are doing floor play try to encourage him to work on his movement luckily walks work well for me too so we do those often as well sorry for the long post so feel your pain incidentally in canada too whereabouts are you in toronto you are not failure babies are complex things and literally every single one is different try not to compare yourself to what you see other friend babies doing know tons of people have said it before but babywearing zomg so helpful other people have made these suggestions but in separate comments so ll just add baby wearing if he ll tolerate it and jumperoo might be what you need hope things get better for you soon going to jump on the baby wearing bandwagon my first needed to be held allthetime she would slowly nurse for 45 minutes pass out at the tap and if so much as breathed the wrong way the cycle started over by months was at my wits end then discovered that beautiful bjorn carrier suddenly she was the perfect infant honestly by 9ish months they re more interested in trying to crawl and grab stuff so hang in there edit should add she will be next month and is very independent now and has been for years still loves to be coddled but definitely enjoys some self time he hates most kinds of baby wearing the only thing he will tolerate is begin face out and even then he only wants to do this if go for walk he is not snuggly guy so really hates being face in he will also let me carry him on hip carry in the ring sling but only if am busily going around the house do use this as strategy sometimes thanks will try the tray of puffs he has really mastered the pincer grip but maybe it will encourage him to practice as with everything he will only tolerate being in his high chair for so long though like max of 10 mins blergh thanks have an excersaucer which think is similar to jumparoo as with all things he will tolerate it for few mins then starts to scream the one thing he will tolerate for slightly longer like 10 15 mins is the jolly jumper he loves jumping have you looked into wonder weeks basically the charted the times that babies are frustrated and working on developing the next milestone and their mood is not so sun shiny make sure the carrier that you get lets you wear him on you back wear my infant on my back so she gets the contact that she needs and get the ability to do the things need to get done while not holding baby have you thought about post partum depression it can begin up to year after you give birth ve had it with all of my babies even take meds with this last baby was on different med and this one worked so much better was able to smile and laugh more so much more smiley with this baby and she is so much more smiley than my other babies she has movies that she loves to watch her dad often puts one of them on when nothing else stops her from crying when not there musical baby https youtu be wdr4gai4lwu she loves watching the babies they also have nature baby baby day and baby moves how often do you have music playing softly in the background whenever my kids get fussy at any age very softly play classical music in the background and they tend to quiet and calm down also is he fussing or full out crying was hoping the sleep thing might be my answer and was clinging to that hope but he has started sleeping great now we did sleep train but still no changes to his demeanour think he is hitting his milestones he rolls both ways and sits unassisted he will play with toy for slightly longer period of time if he is sitting but he still seems to get bored frustrated so quickly he does really explore as he seems to really hate being on his tummy so while encourage him to spend some time there he is not usually in fun play mode when he is and he does log roll around to get places mostly just rolls to his belly and then gets upset he is happier if walk around holding him but really do think it the holding part he wants it the walking around part will do hip carry in the ring sling or face out in the ergo he wo do any face in carries without screaming but there are only so many things can do with him in there ca really cook on hot stove bend over to unload dishes very easily etc plus unless am moving constantly he wants out so if were to wear him and try to fold the laundry for example he would start fussing and then crying until started walking around so exhausting even when he is well rested he is still not happy guy was really hoping this was the answer so sleep trained which needed to happen regardless but his day time behaviour has not changed darn have both of those already he used to enjoy the swing but now just fusses and thrusts his hips trying to get out when put him in and he also used to handle the jumperoo for up to 15 mins but now it usually not more than am at my wits end he does like the jolly jumper can usually get 15 mins out of him in there he can handle about 15 mins in the car before getting bored or upset so definitely take him out when the weather is crappy and just go buy some baby clothes or do some errands etc thank you for telling him that your son got easier am still holding onto hope have been doing this since day one lol it will be easier by weeks months just have to make it to months and then things get easier months then he can eat solids and be independent just have to last until months these have been my mantras and feel like keep getting disappointed but am still doing it anyways right now am hoping that when he can crawl he will be happier can send you some resources or even explain how we did it easy process for both baby and parents sorry but well rested baby can do so much more many women are told that babies should live basically nap to nap and that not entirely true lots of sleep at one time is good for his growth what kind of sleep schedule does he have now usually it means long stretches of sleep at night with small pick me up naps during the day do worry mom thank you so much for the encouraging response have really left him with other people very often though have with my family because of the fact that he is such trying little guy worry that if try to go to the gym and use the daycare there that he would just cry and they would end up calling me back but guess it is worth shot my biggest issue and why came here for support is that my sisters and friends have all had relatively easy or at least average babies and they do not get it at all unless you spend 24 hours in my shoes do think it is possible for them to comprehend they usually brush it off with oh yeah babies are lot of work comment but do think they really know the extent of my situation did things every change for you how does he do in high chair sometimes it change of perspective for them and they can stay occupied for longer ll put my daughter in her high chair give her some puffs or snacks to smack at feed the dog sometimes eat and she ll watch me do the dishes clean the kitchen cook etc she particularly loves watching the microwave if something is in there it sounds silly but also sort of narrate to her what doing and why figure even if she has no clue what saying now at some point she will and it sometimes brings out new vocabulary for them to hear know they re still little and not able to do much at this point but try to incorporate my daughter into any chores have for the day and that helps the tedium of keeping them entertained ll put her in her crib or on blanket on the ground and dump clean laundry over her as sort and fold it she thinks it great and do really care if it gets bit drooly she gets to hold part of the leash when take the dog outside condo dwellers with no fenced in yard and helps me scoop food to feed the pup actually found that when stopped stressing over keeping her happy and occupied and just starting doing things around the house that needed to get done with her in tow she was more apt to stay quiet and was very interested in watching what was going on it definitely is easy or quick keeping wobbly baby on your hip while doing some of this stuff but it okay it not race afterall plus it good learning experience for baby and good lesson in patience for mom not that want it most of the time but know also once he figures out how to roll himself across the room it will get easier on you he ll be there soon enough and you ll be chasing him around and yelling things like do put the dog butt in your mouth and stop licking the vacuum cleaner mama needs to get her own things done and to get rest herself hate to say that breastfeeding has any drawbacks at all because it the most beautiful relationship ve experienced but found that after weaned him did plan to before year but had to in an emergency he became so much more independent and happier just playing with his toys watching his stories he became so independent that he suddenly hit like 20 milestones in like week he was lagging for while but he learned stuff like standing up feeding himself etc all in week and he became 100 less fussy when held him it kinda upsets me still that breastfeeding has any drawbacks but the truth is that it was like night and day he was always fussy when held him unless breastfed and then like literally within day or two he was happy to just be independent or just for me to hold him and play while he laughed we did the ferber method and while it was very hard emotionally it was surprisingly quick fix for sleeping my kid took about days to get it but the majority of babies get it after days suggest going to every possible activity get zoo membership walk around free garden join museums just anything that might be interesting to *you* then at least when you are walking around you can enjoy yourself and your baby is happy being carried worn outwards always felt little silly bringing tiny baby to the zoo or children museum but it was place could go and it was socially acceptable to bring baby it made me feel better to have something to do have to second the jumperoo my son loved jumping not all babies do but it was honestly the only way could put him down for 20 minutes at time he would get tired and then start playing with the toys on the sides love my baby to bits but it really makes me think ca have another always wanted at least kids but this has been so hard guess if going to talk myself into another will have to hope that my next one is easier this was really helpful thank you everything you said resonates with me and is so helpful am going to try those walk off the earth videos he likes books before bedtime so maybe should try more during the day as well thank you feel like we are in constant rotation of keeping him occupied and just really was sure if this was normal it seems like other babies can entertain themselves for at least 20 mins here or there so was really questioning if was doing something wrong he will definitely inspect any new item he comes across so it is challenge to keep him interested in toys because once the inspection is over he would like something new to check out but like you said it does have to be toy it can be paper cup or hat with pattern on it or anything really but some things take longer to inspect than others hahahah am out west in calgary but used to live in toronto ps also have broccoli sucker too funny have fuss butt baby she is toddler now and is completely different person than she was as an infant she had to be held she had to be bounced there was never cry and she ll calm herself or tire out she would cry until she wold vomit turns out she had acid reflux and she was just in pain lot and that she got worse when she would lay down this is why she wanted to be up right and bounced not saying that is the case with your little guy but it worth conversation with your doctor your doctor may also have some advice for you as well my pediatrician often asks about mom and dad mental wellness at the kid appointments because it huge part of parenting thank you yes think this is going to be my life have tried to have lots of at home playtime to encourage floor time and tummy time but this is just not working think need to just get out of the house and be in survival mode for awhile keeping baby happy and just do mins of floor time here and there this is so interesting and another poster mentioned something similar love breastfeeding and am so not ready to give it up but would do it if it caused this dramatic of change but also worried that it might not change anything and then gave up breastfeeding for nothing this is so hard this really resonates with me thank you for responding he does love being in his high chair it seems to me that he does like being confined but then again he loves to stroller so who knows this is something am working on because am trying to do baby led weaning which requires him to be in his high chair for periods of time but he gets mad in there before too long also narrate most of what doing for the exact same reasons he likes listening to me talk and hopefully it will eventually help build his vocab maybe you are onto something and need to just relax just get frustrated so quickly when put him down to start something like cooking or folding laundry and he starts crying so quickly and then do know whether to just let him cry while finish or pick him up and try to entertain him again am equally excited and scared for when he is on the move on the one hand if he happy ll be happy to chase him around all day on the other hand might be eating those words before too long hahahah he is sleeping 11 12 usually closer to 12 hours at night and then first and second naps around around an hour and third nap is 30 40 mins if he sleeps closer to 11 hours then usually one nap will lengthen bit do you think need to be capping his night sleep so he can have longer naps did download the wonder weeks app am actually bit appalled on how much money have spent hoping it is going to result in me either understanding my baby better or making him happier recently bought 100 foam floor mat because thought maybe he just needed better place to play bought him the flashy light up with sound effects toys and then thought ooooh maybe am overstimulating him and then bought wooden blocks and wooden abacus with coloured beads on it for him to play with instead the list goes on sorry this got away from me what we were talking about here but just had to vent about all my silly purchases anyways have found the wonder weeks thing to be all the helpful do like reading about the leaps and knowing what things are changing for him and what skills he is working on but have found him to be any sunnier during those sunny times will check out that musical baby link and will definitely try the classical music often play music in the evenings but it usually music like haha probably not the most soothing and it always starts as fussing it mostly sounds like he is really frustrated like he wants something but it is happening usually it seems like he wants something that just is possible like to pull the tag off the rug and be able to hold it in his hands or to chew on big heavy plastic toy that does actually feel very nice to chew on and then it quickly escalates to full on crying it mostly seems to me that he does have the ability to think hmmm tried that and it did work going to do this instead now but really not sure if that is something babies this age are even capable of in the first place sorry for my really long response he is napping so of course am redditing do sometimes wonder about reflux as he burps lot but never notice that he cries harder after burp or anything like that and he does have any issues at night think just sometimes think that there must be something wrong that is fixable with medicine rather than accepting that my baby has challenging temperament but do agree that it at least worth asking at his next dr appt which is next week what were the other symptoms for your lo at least we know we re not alone hopefully by the time the cold hits our babies will be more independent and driving us crazy exploring the house on their own it was very taxing emotionally because was afraid that our relationship would go anywhere because was afraid he would feel rejection the first few days made sure to hold him more and more hold him close while bottle feeding etc love now how he is he plays in his play pen and practices standing and walking he was barely crawling before warned him took the worst emotional hit though cried for like week he was fine lol it defidently up to you the only reason why connected him always being fussy with me with breastfeeding was because many of the lactation consults in the hospital warned me that he would only associate me with that not in bad way just heads up it was so bad he could even sleep next to my side of the bed in the bassinet cause he would just be fussy and upset soon as his bassinet went to his fathers side he was super calm lol but it all up to you breastfeeding is nothing short of magical almost spiritual think his sleeps actually sound good his brain is getting lot of rest with that 12 hour time frame and his body grows while he sleeps so that his growing time kudos to you for sleep training btw it great for him to recover from all the learning and growing im wondering if the fussiness is lack of being able to do independent play coupled with being fussy on you due to only associating you with food of course that just my observation from my experience but think his sleeping seems fine read and can not link the source right now because it was sourced through my baby app that babies can do 14 hours of sleep and that fine daytime naps wo be too fancy of course as you know haha mine sleeps from 830pm 830am so he does 12 hours and eats every hours all day with short naps you re good mom just want you to know that whatever you decide to do baby will be happy and feel loved because at the end of the day the love that you show him is not forgotten he months now and his attention span has gotten longer and there are more activities that he can do but he needs lot of stimulation and lot of attention there super neat free indoor baby play thing near our house so we do that lot and it will hold his attention for quite while also go there with mom group so there are lot of people cooing at the babies which helps we also spend quite bit of time at grandparents houses since they have more space and it more people giving him attention crawling has been mixed bag it basically means that he can follow me around screaming but he also occasionally goes on his own adventures so guess it has changed insofar as do have to be literally holding him at all times but have him out of the house doing baby activities basically every waking moment think it easier because you know what you re doing the second time but also fingers crossed for an easier baby it does get better even the difficult ones in no time at all your little one will be listening and talking back and communication helps so much hang in there this is pretty much what am expecting for myself have no idea how to go about fostering independent play skills or if that even possible with babies of certain temperaments suppose that what it all boils down to mean obviously want my baby to be happy because it will make my life easier but want him to be happy because well want him to be happy and feel loved always worry when he cries that he feels like am not doing what he needs such tough decision did you find he was less fussy when his dad was playing interacting with him my lo is always so happy when dad comes home but he goes back to being cranky before too long even if it dad who is playing with him may be downvoted for this but little crying and fussing is fine tbh self soothing is good thing to learn that learned through my childhood psychology semester it ll make him secure sleeper like he wo wake up and freak out because it dark because he can just close his eyes and go back to bed every night at around 12am my son wakes up fusses for like 20 seconds and passes out again lol soothing him when he in pain and hurt is what mother should do but little fussing because he bored or is learning to sleep is fine the very first time put my son down to bed when began sleep training he drank his bottle and fussed for 10 minutes then fell asleep do really see it as good sleeper because babies are inherently good but you re teaching him the methods to which he can feel secure comfortable and anxiety free the only person who could hold him was husband lol with me he would be fussy and crazy so could never actually enjoy holding him unless baby wore him that always hurt my feelings would never down vote this sleep trained and did cry it out after investigating other methods that did work part of the reason posted was because was unsure whether should be attending to him every time he cries or not do not want to reinforce the notion that he is not capable of entertaining himself but also do want him to cry all day so finding it really hard to figure out what to do how to respond do do anything if he is fussing but if he ends up crying usually attend to him oh no meant people lurking would do the downvoting ve always gotten the sense on other subs that babies are not suppose to ever fuss and cry and if we allow them to then we re bad parents lol hmmm just wonder why he not wanting to do little independent play does he have any favorite cartoons know mine likes to have his playing while he plays ll put them on my phone they re on you tube then prop up the phone the channel is little baby bum he even has favorite songs too cause may be wrong here but get the sense that he not wanting to have any play time at all or any relaxing time like after meal leave him in the high chair to watch his cartoons and that way he can be entertained while digesting his food mine loves to spit up so he needs to be in that high chair for 20 30 minutes after eating and then after little bit put him in his play area with his cartoons going to be drop dead honest my son never wanted to play in his playpen until weaned him felt so betrayed after weaned and saw so many things change because that means that there are drawbacks to breast feeding and hate thinking that he *will* do some *kind of* independent play but he just does last longer than mins before getting bored frustrated like he will not lay there and play with his feet endlessly like have seen other babies do so pretty much need to be sitting right there ready to intervene with something new to try because he escalates so quickly that why worry that am reinforcing the notion that he ca figure things out himself but he does just fuss he will start bawling inconsolably and then it really hard to get him to calm back down at that point my only option is walk or bath forgive me if im wrong but it does seem like you do much with other people if it helps here typical week with my month old monday rest day at home usually she is bored by the end of the day tuesday 10am library reading session delivered by librarian baby gets to interact with toddlers get new books 11am playdate and lunch with friends and similar aged babies 2ish home for the day probably pick up husband about 4pm wednesday usually day for errands trip into town walk go out for afternoon tea usually out for couple of hours thursday 9am space group supporting parents as child educators in nz and this is freeish service with about ten other mums and babies for three hours babies are mostly engaged in free play on the mat while we discuss different topics about their development and learning afternoon often walk with friends or visiting someone with babies friday have just started attending play centre another nz thing which is like giant play group run by parents goes for three hours afternoon another walk or visit with friends weekend family time trying to fit music group and swimming in there somewhere too having said all that my baby is ridiculously chilled but when she is playing on the floor independently it the exception not the norm so she seems to relish that freedom something else firm believer in is talking to our baby like an adult when it comes to plans good morning baby we ve got big day planned today first we re going to change your nappy then have booby feed then it times to go to space and see the other bubbas after that we will bla bla bla who knows if it helps but it ca hurt good luck my kid spends lottttt of time in carriers as he my second and have stuff to do he does always love it but he will almost always give in after few minutes loosen your straps pop boob in his mouth and go live your life he might fight it little at first but he will get used to it does he have any food allergies or intolerances my daughter had milk protein allergy as an infant and switching to hypoallergenic formula made her totally different baby cutting out dairy can do the same thing although it takes time to make difference if that the problem similar colicky symptoms frequent crying mainly can be caused by other tummy troubles too it might be at least worth mentioning to pediatrician to see what they think my daughter is toddler now and her milk protein allergy has passed still she has kind of sensitive stomach and gets really constipated sometimes she gets clingy and fussy all over again until she has good poop did have him on probiotic for the first months of his life because he always had such bad gas issues and ve been considering putting him back on it think definitely will because it ca hurt today was actually an okay day know this because never brought him into the bath which is always my very last resort so feeling bit better about things and thinking just need to do better job of entertaining him today my goal was to never let him escalate to the point of hysterical crying and though it was exhausting managed thanks we do get together with other mums and babes lots but pretty much always schedule these dates as walk dates it is so not fun for me to do much else because then on the floor trying to keep my babe happy and ca really chat with the other mums or my friends etc that space program sounds great and know there are similar things here but worry that would be able to partake in the adult part because would be attending to my screaming child every few mins am definitely trying to start taking him to the pool because he loves the water so that something am going to start doing weekly and maybe zoo trip as well but at the moment at least we ca really do stationary type things like going to coffee shop or hanging out at friend house so he not even happy interacting with other bubbas this sounds so hard know it might be weird and it not something would do but video of the behaviour might help or perhaps you could video it and show it friends or your dr cos it all so subjective and maybe unlikely but maybe you perceive him to be upset and hes actually just figuring stuff out doubt it from what you have described but maybe if someone else saw it they could offer different perspective removed he *can* be happy around other kids particularly an older child if they are giving him lots of attention and playing with him but as with everything he gets bored quickly and seems to want something else before too long but maybe just need to be more courageous and give him the chance to try more often he definitely would handle being at coffee shop or somewhere he had to sit on my lap for long but it possible he would sit on the floor of someone house with another baby to look at for awhile without getting upset oh boy my daughter is like that she 14 months now but loves to be outside before she could crawl would put her on blanket in the yard with few toys and we would play for bit talk look at things and would get some gardening done at the same time would put her in my moby wrap and go for walks or just get stuff done outside that could do while wearing her when she became mobile she would just follow me around the yard while pulled weeds or sit happily in the jogging stroller when took her running now that she can walk we go outside and pick veggies from our garden she pushed her wagon and other push toys plays in the dirt and with the stones and has ball as long as she outside she ok this is my child if only did live somewhere where freezing cold weather is on it way live in buffalo ny get it yes please have noticed the huge difference in my nephews and nieces behavior when rested or not and definitely see that set sleep is the way we want to go if possible it just learning how to approach it is especially daunting thank you will read up on that oh crap saw this and then got busy and forgot so for us it came down to two different things that he learned that he can sleep by himself and that sleeping is done at night after his routine that never changes in the beginning weeks and months of course baby will be sleeping in the bassinet next to the bed ours moved into the crib in the guest room at months although he was good earlier it just that got little nervous at months and then waited another month lol the first part of sleep training that we did was establish not sleeping in the bed he always slept in his bassinet can admit that for about weeks we did have him sleep in the bed with us but he was premie just by weeks and we wanted our body heat to always keep him warm even though he hated blankets like kid are you suppose to be little chilly in the winter lol the training was slow so he of course as an infant would have regular sleep wake cycles but beginning at weeks started skipping his last nap of the day by keeping him awake and entertained during that nap time would change his clothes breast feed watch tv sing etc his last nap was always from 9pm 10pm but once he started skipping that nap he went to bed at 12am and woke up at 6am do work so spent literally all day attending to his needs and his hunger for anyone who wants to make any snarky comments to me my son always continued to gain weight that how we knew it was ok he gained weight and he was always happy so from that point on his sleep lengths became longer and longer by months he was asleep from 12am 10am decided that the next phase of sleep training would begin choosing an earlier bed time by this time he was in solids and breastmilk so he was defidently getting lot more calories in started with 10pm put him down in his crib at 10pm with bottle and after his bottle he cried for maybe 10 minutes and was out cold by this point put him back in the bassinet few more weeks because just needed to be sure and he continued to sleep through the night btw the bassinet had to be on husband side because if he smelled me he would be fussy and not sleep at months he was back in his bassinet his routine was always bottle in his crib and lights out sometimes he would fall asleep sometimes he would fuss for minute or 10 and fall asleep after few more weeks added in warm bath before bed and also he naturally started to show signals of wanting to go to bed for the night earlier so it turned into 9pm then settled on 8pm so now at ~10 months he expects dinner by 730 bath at 8pm lotioning up and pajamas then bottle he knocks right out and sleeps the night usually as far as naps he naps from 12pm 130pm and again for about 45min 1hour starting around 4pm no matter what always keep to your preferred routine sometimes he ll be very fussy and cranky because he tired and once he in the bath he calms right down because he knows exactly what coming next and he expects it little crying and fussing will not hurt the baby and your baby will not question whether you or dad love it also like to point out that sleeping all night helps his brain recover from the constant learning he does daily since he not just surviving from nap to nap always check for things like weight gain and general demeanor that what always kept me going baby will spend more time awake and eating during the day so be prepared for that my son is no worse for the wear he happy he gaining and he has no sleep issues or sleep anxiety believe that this is more than just training to sleep at night it about reducing night time anxiety levels and adding sense of comfort and security we did do any of the rocking to sleep or any of that have nothing against rocking to sleep but feel that it always kept my son awake and alert so always rock him in the morning just to have some cuddles and sweetness so ymmv but we always put him down to sleep when he knew he was satisfied in his hunger and clean in his diaper and it was time to sleep now he just knocks right out when he put down just remember that your baby will not think that you do love him if he fusses for few minutes assuming he now lol any other questions pm me wow thank you so much for the help just ordered several books on the subject but your post really helped lot can only hope that our little girl will learn as well as your little guy seemed to thanks again no problem know you can do it and your little girl will be sleeping soundly in no time really hope for the best and enjoy parenthood because it so amazing and fun
